query: What does the incredibly simple microprocessor contain?
answer: Even the incredibly simple microprocessor will have a fairly large set of instructions that it can perform\.
optimal_answer: a fairly large set of instructions

query: What contains a fairly large set of instructions that it can perform?

query: How are the collection of instructions implemented?
answer: The collection of instructions is implemented as bit patterns, each one of which has a different meaning when loaded into the instruction register\.
optimal_answer: as bit patterns, each one of which has a different meaning when loaded into the instruction register

query: Are humans good at remembering bit patterns?
answer: Humans are not particularly good at remembering bit patterns, so a set of short words are defined to represent the different bit patterns\.

query: What needs to be done as humans are not particularly good at remembering bit patterns?

query: What are the collection of words called?
answer: This collection of words is called the assembly language of the processor\.

answer: An assembler can translate the words into their bit patterns very easily, and then the output of the assembler is placed in memory for the microprocessor to execute\.
